source: Kentucky Department of Veterans Affairs, Kentucky Housing Corporation, Military.com, Kentucky Commonwealth

resources.name: Kentucky Department of Veterans Affairs
resources.address: 321 W Main Street, Suite 130, Louisville, KY 40202
resources.description: State agency providing comprehensive veteran services including benefits counseling, employment, housing assistance, healthcare, education, and women veteran services

resources.name: Kentucky 211
resources.description: Free, confidential information and referrals for community resources including housing, food, health, employment, legal aid, and veteran services

resources.name: Kentucky Housing Corporation (KHC) - Veterans Programs
resources.description: Partnership with HUD providing housing assistance for veterans through dedicated programs and Housing Choice Vouchers

resources.name: Veterans Emerging Towards Transition (VETT) Program
resources.description: Dedicated housing assistance program for up to 100 homeless Kentucky veterans providing Housing Choice Vouchers in 87 counties

resources.name: Thurman-Abbott Home for Lady Veterans
resources.description: 12-month program providing housing for homeless women veterans, including space for children

resources.name: Kentucky Veterans Employment Training and Support Program (KyVETS)
resources.description: Employment training program offering skills development, resume assistance, networking, and interview preparation for veterans

resources.name: Kentucky State Veterans Centers
resources.description: State-operated facilities providing skilled long-term care and residential services for qualified veterans

resources.name: Kentucky State Veterans Cemeteries
resources.description: State-operated cemeteries providing dignified interment for Kentucky veterans and their spouses

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: Kentucky Public Employees' Deferred Compensation Authority - Veteran Benefits
resources.description: State agency providing benefits information and support for Kentucky veterans

resources.name: Wounded Warrior Project
resources.description: National nonprofit providing support and services for post-9/11 veterans and service members with physical or mental injuries

additional_resources.employment_preference: Veterans preference in public employment - priority in hiring for state and local government positions
additional_resources.vett_program: Veterans Emerging Towards Transition Program - Housing vouchers for up to 100 homeless veterans
additional_resources.va_benefits: https://www.va.gov/ - Comprehensive VA benefits and healthcare

notes: Kentucky has 295,000 veterans with comprehensive state support. The VETT program provides housing assistance for homeless veterans in 87 counties. Call 211 for local resource referrals. Veterans have employment preference in state and local government positions.
